page.title: 08 History-prehistoric caves
page.content: Kents Cavern in Ilsham Road is a limestone cave that is at least 400,000 years old.The caves are just over 150 feet deep inside Lincombe Hill and are 150 feet above sea level.The caverns,named after a local farmer,were first explored in 1824 by Father John Mcenery.In 1865,when William Pengelly excavated the caves,he found remains of many prehistoric animals including mammoths and prehistoric man.In the roof of a passage can be seen a cave bear's skull,an animal's shin bone and a sabre tooth tiger's tooth.There are some beautiful rock formations including stalagmites and stalagtites. One of the rock formations is like an organ with a monk standing in front of it.Kents Cavern is very beautiful and a great tourist attraction.
